setup:
An individual can work for up to 60 hours a week at an hourly wage of \(w=25\). The person has utility over weekly consumption \(c\) and weekly leisure hours \(\ell\) given by: $$ u(c, \ell) = c^{ 3 / 4 }\ell^{ 1 / 4 } $$

Calculate the optimal choice of weekly consumption, leisure hours, and working hours.
solution:
Weekly consumption = \(1125\)

Leisure hours = \(15\)

Working hours = \(45\)

solution: Social welfare system did not change hours worked or consumption.
